item.title: Janrae add a quote by George Gordon Byron
item.description: "If I do not write to empty my mind, I go mad." -- George Gordon Byron

item.title: Janrae add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You must stay drunk on writing so reality cannot destroy you." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Janrae add a quote by kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "As for literary criticism in general: I have long felt that any reviewer who expresses rage and loathing for a novel or a play or a poem is preposterous. He or she is like a person who has put on full armor and attacked a hot fudge sundae or a banana split." -- kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Janrae add a quote by Archibald MacLeish
item.description: "A real writer learns from earlier writers the way a boy learns from an apple orchard -- by stealing what he has a taste for, and can carry off" -- Archibald MacLeish

item.title: Janrae add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "Writing a book is a horrible, exhausting struggle, like a long bout with some painful illness. One would never undertake such a thing if one were not driven on by some demon whom one can neither resist nor understand." -- George Orwell

item.title: Janrae add a quote by Andrew Wyeth
item.description: "If it [talent] isn’t strong enough to take the gaff of real training, then it’s not worth much." -- Andrew Wyeth

item.title: Janrae add a quote by Anton Chekhov
item.description: "Don't tell me the moon is shining; show me the glint of light on broken glass." -- Anton Chekhov

item.title: Janrae add a quote by Jack London
item.description: "You can't wait for inspiration. You have to go after it with a club." -- Jack London

item.title: Janrae add a quote by John Boyd
item.description: "If a man asks me for my loyalty...I will give him my honesty. If a man asks me for my honesty...I will give him my loyalty!" -- John Boyd

item.title: Janrae add a quote by Aesop
item.description: "Better beans and bacon in peace than cakes and ale in fear." -- Aesop
